website_summaries.verdict: Colorful keyboard is designed for both gaming and typing and is helpful for creating good posture and wrist position.
pros: Highly compatible with no drivers required
cons: It's expensive, and a few buyers were less than completely satisfied with the stability of the wrist rest

customer_reviews.title: Not built for big hands
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Per-key RGB lighting is legit - comfortable and compact - game keys are useful - switches and key caps feel great Cons: - tilt kit sold separately - palm rest is useless if your hands are bigger than average because there is no way to extend it out. It actually gets in the way (see photos). - going to have to return the tilt kit and get the one made for no palm rests since I’ll be throwing those out
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Wish it included the riser stands but that's ok. This is an excellent high quality keyboard for gaming or programming, which is actually what I mainly use it for. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: A. T.

customer_reviews.title: The glued on foam "feet" fall off after just a week!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is clearly extremely well made. The keys, the palm rests, the cables... all great! I really love it. But... WHY DO THEY SKIMP AND PUT GARBAGE FOAM FEET ON IT! After just one week, one of the foam feet came unstuck. After two weeks, another did the same. I keep sticking them back on, but they keep falling off. On any other keyboard, I'd say "so what" -- but this keyboard cost $200, and is sold on how "well made it is". Now, all I can do is wonder where else they cut corners (because they clearly cut corners on the foam feet).
customer_reviews.author: ed

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. It relieved all of the pressure in my neck and back. It also allows my wrists to be at a normal angle and relieves pain in my wrists after long days of work. I can never go back to a normal keyboard again. The mechanical keys feel great. The palm wrests are comfortable and the keyboard feels high quality. I like it so much I bought two. One for each of my offices. The one thing I don't like is that there are no keyboard lifters attached, like on a normal keyboard. I wish they had that option included. They have something that may work but it is expensive. I don't like this.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Great as always. Minus one star as they dont come up Mac Keycaps
customer_reviews.text: They are great, and feel the same as FreeStyle pro with the hand-rests actually better than the pro. Ability to adjust LED colors is great, and the lighting effects are pretty cool. I do not use it for gaming, but rather use it as my primary work keyboard with a MacBookPro. The negative comments: 1. The stand accessory that needs to be purchased separately is not as stable as the pro. By not stable I mean, it sometimes would close just by a slight push, which is a bit frustrating, though it is not too bad. 2. They don't come with Mac Keycaps which the Pro Keyboard comes with. Didn't know this, and needs to purchased separately.
customer_reviews.author: Romanch

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup - relief for neck and shoulders
customer_reviews.text: I just received the keyboard less than an hour ago. I got the MX Brown switches and I really like the responsiveness and the clickety sounds. For the first time, I am leaning back while typing, and all the stress is off my shoulders and neck. I have a neck injury that affects my shoulders and this is a game changer for me. Typing on a split keyboard is a new experience. It's weird how my hands feel like they're competing with one another so some of the letters are jumbled but, even after just a few minutes, that is becoming more infrequent. I've never spent this kind of money on a keyboard but so far it feels worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Helene Gray

customer_reviews.title: My favorite keyboard of all time
customer_reviews.text: Hard to say anything bad about it. I'm mostly worried about losing features if they make a follow up product. The macros and customization is perfect. It is done in text files, 0 BS about it. There is some software for it but its light. I would just hate to see it become some annoying, super-branded, cumbersome software in the future. Right now, its so reasonable. When the only worry you have is the possible software on a future iteration, the product is very good. Silver switches don't come on all keyboards too, so pretty happy about that. I have large hands and the rests are fine. Not totally ergo for me (nothing really fits) but much better than nothing.
customer_reviews.author: J. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Product box took a beating...
customer_reviews.text: Outer mailing box looked fine, but inside, the actual product box had quite a bit of damage. The keyboard LOOKS fine, but I will not know if it is actually damaged until my son opens it xmas day and plugs it in. This is a high dollar, technological item and I worry that it will not work properly judging by the condition of the box. It took a beating before it was put into the shipping box. :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, and made much better with blue O-rings on Cherry MX brown.
customer_reviews.text: Thankful to kinesis for making such a great product. Cannot imagine typing on any other keyboard after trying one of their split mechanical keyboards. I am a programmer but I prefer the looks of the gaming keyboards more than their pro editions. And like the palm support that comes default with this model (Though I prefer taking out the soft cushion and use it with the hard plastic support - The soft part is just attached to plastic with a velcro and removable). If you want to make the best out of this, make sure to try out the blue O-rings with the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Sceptic

customer_reviews.title: Quality keyboard, what you'd expect from Kinesis.
customer_reviews.text: I've seen mentions that the Freestyle is too small for large hands, well, I don't know how big your hands are but the Freestyle is as large as a standard keyboard. (see attached photo). The Freestyle Edge takes some getting used to, not quite as much as the Advantage line, but there is a learning curve. The risers, sold separately, are a must. Honestly Kinesis should include them, even if it means jacking up the price. I now have three Kinesis keyboards. A 10 year old KB103 at the office, a new KB600 for working at home and now the Freestyle for play. Kinesis makes quality keyboards (and you pay for it.) They take a pounding and last.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M McCormack

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Tactile feedback from the Cherry MX Blue switches. - The color looks great -- I wish the lights would stay off when you unplug/replug the device, but it's subtle enough to use at work. - 20" seperation between the two halves. - Very solid build quality -- really feels like a premium product. Cons: - Lift kit sold separately. Without the lift kit, it's not nearly as comfortable. - No wireless option. Kinesis does sell a wireless split keyboard, but it uses rubber dome keys rather than mechanical keys. Overall: One of the few mechanical split keyboards on the market and it's quite pricey, but lives up to the hype.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: The best gaming keyboard !!!
customer_reviews.text: Simply amazing, the best keyboard you can use made of a high quality material is really worth what it costs I use it to play at work and it is unbeatable to any other keyboard, both ergonomic, gamer or professional programmer, its cherry brown mechanical mechanism is what you need if you play and program I connected it to the nintendo switch and it plays fantastic for its low latency you feel a difference between the joycons and this keyboard is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Ulises Estevez

customer_reviews.title: Very ergonomic.
customer_reviews.text: I'm an old guy. This keyboard allows me to position the left side of the keyboard, and my mouse in the most comfortable positions possible. Great for gaming. Likewise, for regular typing, no carpal stress, very comfortable. The only downside is that there is not a dedicated number keypad. I'm a CPA, and a 10-key type keypad is a necessity. Easily solvable, but wish this company made such a device.
customer_reviews.author: JHMcLellan

customer_reviews.title: Clearly got a used device
customer_reviews.text: Got an OBVIOUSLY returned product. I also bought the tenting kit which also was very clearly a returned product. Very annoyed since this is quite a lot of money to spend on a used item that potentially could have issues that the original owner returned it for and I simply haven’t discovered yet. However it feels nice and is already much better feeling than a regular keyboard and doesn’t appear like it’ll take much time to get used to. I haven’t figured out the programming yet but the app looks of good quality. I bought this specifically because it’s supposed to be the best ergonomic keyboard and I have an office job.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Whaley

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: feels great, ergonomic, and looks great overall. i'm very impressed with the quality and i'm at the computer nonstop. this was a very nice upgrade from my black widow. i'd recommend it if its within your price range. i use it professionally and for gaming. i also got the tents so i can pitch these at a bit of an angle, that really helps!
customer_reviews.author: chet

customer_reviews.title: Solid Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I really like using this keyboard. Especially with the tent kit. I can have the keyboard at just the right position and it took no time to get used to it from having a standard flat keyboard. The brown switches feel good and the keyboard feels solid. I like the feel of the palm/wrist as well. They are just the right mix of comfort and support for me.
customer_reviews.author: tgarlan2

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Best ergonomic keyboard I've ever had! Easy to adapt to whatever position I need them, without forcing my wrists together or any other unnatural positions. Can't recommend this keyboard enough!
customer_reviews.author: Christine H. Rietsch

customer_reviews.title: Don't get without the Lift Kit
customer_reviews.text: Kinesis really just needs to include the Lift Kit (Tenting for The Freestyle Edge) as it'd return this without the other purchase. So add $25-$30 for the add-on. If this was the case this is a 5 star product. As a set, wrist pain is down significantly. The first week of using I worked an extra hour or two each day because I lost track of time and my wrists didn't ache. Great mechanical keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: BA23

customer_reviews.title: Great Ergonomics and features. Glad I upgraded from other "natural" and "comfort" keyboards.
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard. Finally a great ergonomic backbit keyboard. I went with the Brown Cherry keys. It is a little louder than I thought it would be, but I think I will get used to that. I ordered the lift kit also. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Love This keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I have the non-led version at work and it has done wonders for my wrists and elbows. I'm a big guy (6' 4" ogre) and the ability to spread these wide has made typing so comfortable. I'm a software developer by trade and hours of typing just don't bother me. This has been an exceptional purchase since it maintains the standard key layout while being fully split (unlike the ergodox) not to mention being highly affordable for a mechanical keyboard. I'll use one of these until the day they make a direct brain interface. Love. This. Keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce Liskovec

customer_reviews.title: helped my tendonitis
customer_reviews.text: After switching from a non-ergo keyboard to the Kinesis, my thumb and finger joint pain has gone away. I attribute this to being able to adjust the direction each keyboard-half points. The cherry mx red key switches feel super smooth. The key backlighting helps with seeing the keys.
customer_reviews.author: amazon reviewer

customer_reviews.title: I love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I am a software developer, so, I live on my keyboard. Mechanical keys = loud. Lights are fun. Programmability is okay; not for quick macros, but, for things that will be used in the long term. I can't wait to take this back to the office and annoy the heck out of my office mates :-D
customer_reviews.author: W. Dolak

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic, pricey, but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I'm typing this on my keyboard right now, and I gotta say it's a total game changer. The keys are smooth, the ability to move it around to make my hands hurt less is a god send, and gaming on it is a dream. That being said, my chief complaint is that it doesn't include the all-but required tenting kit. The fact that you pay a premium to get the keyboard anyway, and then have to add-on some snap-on plastic for 30ish dollars feels like a raw deal for an otherwise flawless and amazing keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Over priced hype.  Not for typing.  Maybe good for gaming.
customer_reviews.text: MX Brown keys were too noisy. It is not a keyboard built for ergonomics, but just a normal keyboard cut in half. You have to spend another $30 for the tilting setup. The movable halves move and confuse your hand/brain coordination. It is built for gaming not for typing. The keys sounded and felt exactly like the much more affordable made in China ones. This is also made in China !!!!!! Got the Logitech ERGO K860 instead. Way better.
customer_reviews.author: Fair Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a high price
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - High quality material (especially the wrist pads). - Split layout with lift kit is comfortable for long term use (once you get used to it). - Keys have enough travel for comfortable typing. - Backlights look cool when showing off to friends. Cons: - Really expensive. - Lights are somewhat gimmicky. - Keys are not replaceable. - Brown switches are still really loud. - Lift kit is sold separately. For such an expensive ergonomic keyboard, I'd expect this crucial piece to come with it.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Mansour

customer_reviews.title: Might have to get another one for the office!
customer_reviews.text: Took me a bit to get used to but it now feels soo good! I didn't realize how much I was rounding my shoulders for hours at a time! The palm rest also feels really good and love the built in macro (no need for additional software). Definitely on the pricey side but well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: SxLxUxGxZ

customer_reviews.title: Does not include V3 tenting kit
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is a dissapointment. It is not easy to map the Windows and Alt keys to the Mac OS Command and Option keys because the SmartSet App that the keyboard uses is not usable on Mac OS Catalina (or Mac OS Mojave). Additionally, the keyboard doesn't come with a tenting kit which is an additional $25. Lastly, the Mac OS modifier keys are sold separately for an additional $25. For such an expensive keyboard, I would expect these items to be included. Lastly, the function keys do not correctly work with Mac OS laptops. For example, volume up and down do not impact the laptop's volume.
customer_reviews.author: Rootul Patel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect keyboard for EVERYTHING
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best ergonomic keyboard one can get for both gaming and work, that I can think of. Kinesis split keyboard design is a nice balance between non-ergonomic keyboards (pain!) and more ergonomic keyboards (complicated to get adjusted to!). It fits the right balance between quality and ease of use. I've bought the Cherry MX Brown keys and I love them. I also tried Blue keys and they are fine too, just they are a bit too loud if you intend to use the keyboard while being on conference, or gaming, calls.
customer_reviews.author: Srecko

customer_reviews.title: Great mechanical ergo keyboard but a bit pricey.
customer_reviews.text: I've used several ergo keyboards but non were for gaming or mechanical, just plane cheap keyboards. The completely split design is my preferred ergo style, I can custom tweak the angle for each wrist. Definitely add the lift kit.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Parke

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for work, I wanted a more comfortable keyboard. Also, I thought that this keyboard would allow me to customize it without having to download an app for my work computer, for which I do not have admin permission. Unfortunately, that’s not the case. Despite being described as running from the keyboard, the app does require download to a computer. Oh well. Otherwise, the keyboard is well built, very stable, and has great keys. I’m sure I will enjoy using it.
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: The keyboard I've been waiting for!
customer_reviews.text: I am on a computer ~8hrs a day plus. I switched to the normal kinesis keyboard a few years ago. I have one for home and one for work. I've been waiting forever to get my hands on an ergo mechanical keyboard. Finally Kinesis released one! I ended up getting two because normal switches feel like sponges by comparison. I started building an ErgoDox but haven't had the time to finish it.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal Lattice

customer_reviews.title: ergo WhaT?
customer_reviews.text: I would like to say hands down this is the most comfortable keyboard I have had in ages... the mechanical key noise is way less than my razer black mamba, I can actually hear other noise now when I'm typing. instead of my rapid fire machine gun. I have yet to work with any of the macro functions but looking forward to playing when them. From a standard gaming set you have to get used to the split keyboard much like using mouse with a Nostromo from back in the day. Functionally is wonderful. 5/5 for me today.
customer_reviews.author: David Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent high-quality ergonomic keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product, the keyboard is very well-made and performs perfectly, the configuration is a bit clunky but you wouldn't be buying this only for the RGB (I hope). Wrist rests are terrible quality, flimsy, cheap material, pads are separating from the plastic after two weeks....this part is very sad as it seems like they're not even from the same company.
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo P.

customer_reviews.title: My first, definitely not the last
customer_reviews.text: My first ergonomic mechanical keyboard and it's _very_ good. The V-drive (on-board storage to save configs) works really well; the only thing I would improve is a Linux gui for editing the config files.
customer_reviews.author: Thleats

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I like this keyboard. Keys are easy to use and I love being able to move the parts of the keyboard around depending on need. Macros are easy to program and I love being able to manage the key colors. My only complaint is the location of the esc key. I have this same non-gaming keyboard for work and the esc keys are in different locations. This then moves the function keys over one.
customer_reviews.author: RussT

customer_reviews.title: Lift Kit (riser) not included for a $200 Keyboard? Come on!
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard is made of high quality and solidly build. Cherry MC Brown feels great and reasonably quiet. I love the included wrist pad. RGB lighting is bit dim (I had COrsaird RGB before) and color pattern options are pretty limited but overall pleasing. One thing that really, really bothered me about this keyboard is that I have to buy the lift kit separately for $25. Come on, keyboard costs $200, you couldn't include the lift kit?
customer_reviews.author: Tae Chang

customer_reviews.title: Great successor of Kinesis PRO
customer_reviews.text: I've been using kinesis PRO at the office for 4 years, at some point I decided to buy same or similar keyboard for home use, and I can tell - Kinesis Gaming impressed me. Frosted plastic, extra comfy palm pads, great button response (mx brown is slightly tougher than kinesis pro default switches, but response provides a physical pleasure). The only thing bothers me is an Esc button changed position compare to the Pro model. But it's kind of seats in more logical place right now, so it's not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Danila Kolesnikov

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic board
customer_reviews.text: Really awesome keyboard if this is the style of keyboard you're looking for. I've owned it for a few months now and it has worked flawlessly. I will say, its usefulness is very limited without the lift kit so be prepared to spend extra on that. Only 4 stars because it is a little overpriced for what you get, but the keyboard itself if excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good ergo, but not for ideal for Mac users
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard for my Mac when my wrists started hurting from typing too much on a traditional keyboard. I ended up returning this item because of the cons mentioned below. Pros: - good ergonomics, can position hands in any position - high quality materials - comfortable and responsive typing. Cons: - For Mac users, the command key is too far to the left which actually caused more strain when doing shortcuts like "Command+T" for new creating a new browser tab which I commonly do. This is the main reason why I ended up returning this item. - Takes up a good amount of space on your desk. - No bluetooth
customer_reviews.author: Simmy

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and convenient
customer_reviews.text: This is the best keyboard I've used simply due to its flexibility. I can move one side out of the way or make them super far apart or close together. I really enjoy the tenting (sideways tilt) as well. I never realized how uncomfortable it was to have your arms close together on a normal keyboard until I got this. I could never go back. My one issue is that I missed out on the limited Speed Silver switches. Please bring them back Kinesis! I would gladly pay $400 for this keyboard with silvers.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Comparison with previous version Freestyle Edge Model KB950
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box I can tell a couple keys are in different positions. The lighting is of course very nice. The palm support cushion is nice, but feels a bit high for me personally. I might use the ones I got with the last model. My last one (Model KB950) lasted for a year and a half, so I'm hoping this one will last longer. This one comes with a 2 year warranty, compared with a 1 year warranty with the last one, so that's good.
customer_reviews.author: DarkVoice

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product and Worth the Price
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard exceeds expectations. I don’t game, but I work from my home office and type all day. I’ve had it 2 days and can resolutely recommend this ergonomic keyboard. Plus the color options are really fun, not just for me, but the kiddos love it too. Excellent value for the price!
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Dubble nubble
customer_reviews.text: I have come to hate it. The "d" key has the same nub on it that the "f" key has for finding where to position your left hand by touch. This misplaced nub efs up my hand position a thousand times a day. It makes typing a disaster, it makes gaming a disaster, it makes using keyboard shortcuts a disaster.
customer_reviews.author: Evident Divide

customer_reviews.title: Relieves shoulder tension
customer_reviews.text: Now that I know how much more comfortable using a split keyboard is, I wish I hadn’t waited so long to make the switch. I noticed much less shoulder tension and pain almost right away. I love how much flexibility there is with arrangement of this keyboard, and the light options are cool. I use mine with a RollerMouse, which isn’t ideal but is workable.
customer_reviews.author: KB173691

customer_reviews.title: Needs some practice
customer_reviews.text: It is very well made and a great feel to the clicks of the keys. It is also better for my wrists. but, I needed to practice a lot to get my fingers in the right place. I do touch type but probably used the wrong fingers for the letters and you can't do that with a split keyboard. So I went through a typing course, which probably helped anyway!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love mine ... we from ms natural key wanted mechanical keys
customer_reviews.text: amazing, love mine. Took some getting used to, but great once you do. You need the tilt stands .. else nearly useless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Support is great!
customer_reviews.text: PROS: - I have big hands, and with the lift kit, typing on this is super comfortable. 8+ hours typing per day and my hands have never felt better. This is honestly the only thing I cared about, and for me, it's perfect. - Easy to program macros - Support is helpful and quick to respond CONS: - Expensive, and lift kit costs extra :/ - The cable that links the two halves of the keyboard together randomly died after about 8 months of use. Support diagnosed it and sent me a new cable within a week, and now it's working flawlessly again.
customer_reviews.author: lilith

customer_reviews.title: The split keyboard allows you to position your hands without twisting to match the home row.
customer_reviews.text: It is way better than a linear keyboard. With the linear keyboard the hands have to been inside your body frame to use the interior keys. A split keyboard allows you to eliminate that cramping angle. The keys are light and responsive. i am a little concerned about the wrist rests _ they seem lightweight but there is a two year warranty on the box so time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says on the box!
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality product. I use it for work. Zero complaints. Was worth the hours spent scouting the Internet for a keyboard that checked all the boxes for me. Happy customer here.
customer_reviews.author: Sable Arachnid

customer_reviews.title: Best Keyboard I've Ever Had!
customer_reviews.text: Everything about the keyboard is awesome, especially the reprogrammable keys. It took a bit to figure out the software, but once I did I really liked being able to reprogram everything! Also, if you have a Twitch or other game platform stream this will really differentiate you - I get comments on my stream about my keyboard all the time now!
customer_reviews.author: Matt Schlenker

customer_reviews.title: Superb quality
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this keyboard. I've been working a lot more lately due to an upcoming release, and man, this keyboard saved me. It took me a day or two to get used to, mostly because I've never used a separated keyboard before. I love the feel of it, and the response of the keyboard is great as well. I got the "tent" accessory to prop it up too. This is a great keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholaus

customer_reviews.title: A great ergonomic keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard. It does take time to get used to being split. The lifts, properly installed, works great. If you are having trouble with the keyboard plopping down, you should take the lift off, reverse it, and reinstall it. My arms no longer feel squeezed in like on regular keyboards. The keys have a good feel and gives clicks. It feels solid and, definitely, does not feel cheap. The RGB is ok but I'm not really into rgb. I would recommend this keyboard to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic KB
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a gaming KB ans was hesitant due to the price but wow. I love being able to change the angle. It took a little getting used to but feels great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Just got this and it works and feels even better than the original. I was surprised that the tilting adapter I already had didn’t fit. The wrist pads are very comfortable I hope they last. The lighting is nice and fun obviously doesn’t effect performance but it is fun.
customer_reviews.author: Gdebt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: Everything I was looking for, I highly recommend the brown switches for gaming! they don't make much noise, and there is no finger fatigue after playing for long hours!!
customer_reviews.author: Toni Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Great design, lacking in quality.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice design, overall quality seems to be lacking. I question if they use name brand switches or not, as I have issues with the left shift key sticking, which is a bit of a nuisance in gaming. Perhaps it needs a cleaning, but for a brand new unit I was a bit disappointed and sadly it's been moved to a secondary keyboard. I did like being able to have my mouse in between the two halves for gaming, but oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: The best ergonomic keyboard on the market
customer_reviews.text: This is arguably the best all-around ergonomic keyboard money can buy. I'm using it for both coding and gaming and it works great for both. The tenting kit should have been included with the keyboard, because it's really needed to make the most out of the keyboard. I'm using the medium angle and it really helps to keep my wrist pain free. I would recommend this keyboard to anyone who wants to have a high quality ergonomic keyboard, for either gaming or writing / development.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard ever!
customer_reviews.text: The most ergonomic keyboard. Allows you to sit properly, open up your shoulders. Programming lighting and function is easy. Its expensive but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Erik F Englund

customer_reviews.title: hard to configure with Mac
customer_reviews.text: Very ergonomic and easy to use. Key press is good. Only problem is it is hard to configure with mac to use it as a normal keyboard. Otherwise good.
customer_reviews.author: Aashu

customer_reviews.title: Awesome keyboard in all aspects, only complain is that at least 5% tilt should be built in
customer_reviews.text: Split keyboard is super comfortable to use, the mechanical key switches are amazing (got brown) and it is impressively simple to program, upgrade, remap. It's basically a plaintext file change on a usb drive, the linux way! I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Henrique Abreu

customer_reviews.title: Really, really like this keyboard~
customer_reviews.text: I'm having to learn to use the number keys at the top, and where the delete, home, backspace, end, up & down keys are, but that's doable. I love the like sounds that help me know when I've hit the right button, the feel of the buttons, etc. The lights are just fun.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Sick
customer_reviews.text: Honestly super top notch. Switches rock, features rock, build quality is exceptional. Would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Colton Wills

customer_reviews.title: Takes a while to get used to, but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard definitely takes a while getting used to, it took me up more than a week. But it is super comfy for your wrist and hand support once you figure out how to use it
customer_reviews.author: Madeline

customer_reviews.title: Great for programmers working long days
customer_reviews.text: Like: Love the programmable macros Dislike: Way to expensive. I would buy a second but it's rediculous how much this thing costs....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade from my Microsoft Natural Ergonomic Keyboard 4000
customer_reviews.text: Love the LED lights and with the lift kit. It feels better than my old Microsoft Natural Ergonomic Keyboard 4000.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Clements

customer_reviews.title: Great ergonomic keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The split design is really helpful for maintaining proper posture and shoulder positioning. The typing itself is also fast & precise by virtue of it being a mechanical keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Todor Markov

customer_reviews.title: Not ergonomically sound. Key clicks are too loud. Key labels are upside down.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard comes without tilting, which makes it ergonomically unsound. Tilting must be purchases separately :-( Also the key clicks are way too loud. Furthermore, the key labels are upside down.
customer_reviews.author: a Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this Keyboard!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the feel of this keyboard. I'm a transcriptionist and a court reporting student, so I use it a lot. I love this keyboard even though I haven't even begun to understand its full capabilities. I hope it lasts forever, but if it doesn't, I will be buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: kindle-fied

customer_reviews.title: Loving the split layout. Wished the optional tenting kit came standard.
customer_reviews.text: Of all the keyboards I have, this is my favorite. The split layout is very ergonomic and the programmable keys make it a delight to work on. My only wish was that the $24 tenting kit came standard. It is a must and makes a huge difference in ergonomics.
customer_reviews.author: ksint

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product that's well made. I love the feeling of a mechanical keyboard. And for a large guy like me the split really helps. If you're going to order one of these I recommend that you check out the different key depression options available to get the right one for you.
customer_reviews.author: Phineas J Scarlock

customer_reviews.title: For business and fun 😀😀😀
customer_reviews.text: I got the cherry brown switches and its great! This replaced my Logitech g60 since I'm working from home due to the rona virus. I've used this brand for ergo keyboards at work for years and highly recommend. Great keyboard and makes my desk look cool af.
customer_reviews.author: Ramona Estibalis

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very comfortable keyboard to use. The stands should have been included.
customer_reviews.author: Steven W. Eckhoff

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Very ergonomic, my arms and shoulders felt the difference. The material feels pretty well. Helps me to type faster The only deffect is that the lift kit should be included , as it doesn't its a must buy
customer_reviews.author: David González

customer_reviews.title: Good tented keyboard with great key feel
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard worked very well for me in terms of ergonomics and overall feel. Recommend it highly with the tenting accessory.
customer_reviews.author: Randyartoo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome keyboard. A bit expensive
customer_reviews.text: Love the keyboard just for its ergonomics and gaming ability. I would have given this keyboard 5 stars but its too expensive and you also need to purchase lifters separately.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid and nice design
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is very nice. The quality of wire is very good, it is quite hard to blend or fold and should have a long lifetime. Needed some time to adjust for keyboard settings with extra keys on the left. But overall a solid and nice design keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: COLORS
customer_reviews.text: THE COLORS !!!!! I LOVE IT! I only wish you could prop it up a little
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few gaming keyboards but this is by far my favorite! Very well built and the rgb is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Marcus

customer_reviews.title: The App is acting up
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is pretty solid. I like it. It def takes some time to get used to the split layout if you first move from a conventional keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Junan Qu

customer_reviews.title: The best keyboard I have owned!
customer_reviews.text: There are no compromises here. Build quality is great, the feel is great. 10/10 Well done!
customer_reviews.author: mikestaub

customer_reviews.title: Very good ergonomic
customer_reviews.text: Very good ergonomic. However, you must purchase an additional lift kit. This is unfortunate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for those who type all day
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! I code a ton fora living and this has been just what the doctor ordered
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Prefect upgrade from Microsoft Sculpt
customer_reviews.text: Set the second spacebar to delete and your life will never be the same.
customer_reviews.author: Enward Saier

product_meta.title: KINESIS Gaming Freestyle Edge RGB Split Mechanical Keyboard (MX Red)
feature_bullets: Versatile split design great for typing and gaming: move the right module out of the way and bring your mouse in close for improved endurance and more precise aim (eSports proven). rotate the left module for optimal key coverage or to squeeze into a tight space at a LAN. Or split the modules up to 20 inches and put your stream mic, HOTAS, or mouse in the middle for easy access. Separate the modules to shoulder-width for an ergonomic typing posture and add the lift kit tenting accessory to reduce forearm strain. The detachable Palm Supports now include all-new thick cushioned palm pads for even more comfort.

100% Mechanical switches for maximum performance: genuine Cherry MX Red mechanical switches (low-force, linear feel) offer professional-grade responsiveness and unmatched durability (50M clicks). choose the switch that's right for you.

Immersive RGB lighting for a signature look: 16.8M Color per-key RGB Backlighting with 10 customizable effects like wave, spectrum, rebound, pulse, rain and much more. Install lighting expansion pack 1 to add Dual layer lighting and two-tone effects.

All 95 keys are fully programmable for complete customization: Use the dedicated SmartSet key for convenient on-the-fly Remaps and macros, or use the all-new SmartSet app for special actions or to customize lighting effects. 9 Available profiles with dual layers, powerful macros, quick Remaps, 9 game keys, 1ms response time, NKRO, game mode, & much more. All profiles and settings save directly to the keyboard's 4MB onboard memory for Tournament play.
100% plug-and-play: compatible with Windows, Mac, Linux, and chrome (1 full-size USB port required). no special drivers required. Rgb SmartSet app for Windows and Mac available for download.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars276 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
